Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Crate \Crate\ (kr[=a]t), n. [L. cratis hurdle; perh. akin to E. cradle. See {Hurdle}, and cf. {Crate} a framework.] 1. A large basket or hamper of wickerwork, used for the transportation of china, crockery, and similar wares. [1913 Webster]
2. A box or case whose sides are of wooden slats with interspaces, -- used especially for transporting fruit. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: crate \crate\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Crated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Crating}.] To pack in a crate or case for transportation; as, to crate a sewing machine; to crate peaches. [1913 Webster]

crate n 1: a rugged box (usually made of wood); used for shipping 2: the quantity contained in a crate [syn: {crateful}] v : put into a crate; as for protection; "crate the paintings before shipping them to the museum" [ant: {uncrate}]
